org.apache.zookeeper.test

Class LeaderSessionTrackerTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.zookeeper.ZKTestCase
      • org.apache.zookeeper.test.LeaderSessionTrackerTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Watcher

    public class LeaderSessionTrackerTest
extends ZKTestCase
implements Watcher
    Due to race condition or bad client code, the leader may get request from expired session. We need to make sure that we never allow ephmeral node to be created in those case, but we do allow normal node to be created.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.apache.zookeeper.Watcher

        Watcher.Event, Watcher.WatcherType

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.apache.zookeeper.ZKTestCase

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void process(WatchedEvent event) 
      void setUp() 
      void tearDown() 
      void testCreateEphemeral(boolean localSessionEnabled)
      When we create ephemeral node, we need to check against global session, so the leader never accept request from an expired session (that we no longer track) This is not the same as SessionInvalidationTest since session is not in closing state
      void testCreatePersistent()
      When local session is enabled, leader will allow persistent node to be create for unknown session
      void testExpiredSessionWithLocalSession() 
      void testExpiredSessionWithoutLocalSession()
